Material.name: Tessellation
Material.desc: Material which provides tessellation parameters.

Param.name: HeightScale
Param.desc: Scales the values in the height map to be able to reach outside the range [0..1]

Param.name: MinDistance
Param.desc: The minimal distance at which tessellation should start, tessellation will be applied between this value and MaxDistance

Param.name: MaxDistance
Param.desc: The maximal distance at which tessellation should stop, tessellation will be applied between this value and MinDistance

Param.name: TessellationFactor
Param.desc: Maximum level of tessellation, spawns X more triangles per triangle

Material.name: Static
Material.desc: PBR + IBL based dielectric/metal material.

Material.name: Static + Alpha test
Material.desc: PBR + IBL based dielectric/metal material, but with added alpha testing.

Material.name: Static + Alpha blending
Material.desc: PBR + IBL based dielectric/metal material. With alpha blending.

Material.name: Static + Emissive
Material.desc: PBR + IBL based dielectric/metal material. With added emissive mapping.

Material.name: Organic
Material.desc: Specialized PBR + IBL based dielectric/metal material, but with an added subsurface scattering pass.

Param.name: SubsurfaceStrength
Param.desc: The strength of the subsurface approximation, the higher, the blurrier

Param.name: SubsurfaceWidth
Param.desc: The radius for the subsurface approximation

Param.name: SubsurfaceCorrection
Param.desc: Performs corrections to some extent, tune to fit your needs

Material.name: Skinned
Material.desc: Skinned version PBR + IBL based dielectric/metal material, but with added alpha testing.

Material.name: Skinned + Alpha test
Material.desc: Skinned version of the static PBR + IBL based dielectric/metal material, but with added alpha testing.

Material.name: Skinned + Alpha blending
Material.desc: Skinned material which uses a mesh with joint indices and joint weights, and is also alpha-blended. Useful for characters. Affected by lights.

Material.name: Skin
Material.desc: Skinned material which uses a mesh with joint indices and joint weights. Uses a subsurface scattering approximation to simulate an organic material. Useful for characters. Affected by lights.

Param.name: SubsurfaceStrength
Param.desc: The strength of the subsurface approximation, the higher, the blurrier

Param.name: SubsurfaceWidth
Param.desc: The radius for the subsurface approximation

Param.name: SubsurfaceCorrection
Param.desc: Performs corrections to some extent, tune to fit your needs

Material.name: MultilayeredTessellated
Material.desc: Special material used for meshes with vertex colors. RGB controls the influence of each texture layer in order 1,2,3. Supports tessellation. Affected by lights.

Material.name: Water
Material.desc: Standard material which looks like water. Uses the xz-coordinates for the vertices to tile the normal map. Renders foam when the distance is close to a surface based on a threshold. Is not affected by lights.

Param.name: WaveMap
Param.desc: The wave map describes how the water should be displaced and bump mapped. Should be in the form of an RGB normal map, with the A channel representing the height of the wave.

Param.name: HeightMap
Param.desc: The height map is used to calibrate the waters displacement and transparency along shores. The closer the value is to 0, the weaker the waves the will be.

Param.name: TileSize
Param.desc: The size of each tile of water

Param.name: FogDarkColor
Param.desc: Color of dark fog

Param.name: FogBrightColor
Param.desc: Color of bright fog

Param.name: WaveMicroScale

Param.name: WaterScatterColor

Param.name: WaterSpecular
Param.desc: Specular color of the water

Param.name: WaterColorIntensity
